content.question: The velocity vector of a particle moving in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane has components given by <math alttext="the derivative of x, with respect to t, equals t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to t, equals, e raised to the negative 2 t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. If the initial position of the particle at <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="3 comma negative 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following expressions gives the particle’s position <math alttext="open angled bracket, x of t, comma, y of t, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="x of t, equals, the integral from 0 to t, of, s squared, d s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>d</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, the integral from 0 to t, of, e raised to the negative 2 s power, d s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow></msup><mi>d</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x of t, equals, the integral from 3 to t, of, s squared, d s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>d</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, the integral from negative 5 to t, of, e raised to the negative 2 s power, d s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow></msup><mi>d</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x of t, equals, 3 plus, the integral from 0 to t, of, s squared, d s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>d</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, negative 5 plus, the integral from 0 to t, of, e raised to the negative 2 s power, d s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow></msup><mi>d</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x of t, equals, 3 plus, the integral from 3 to t, of, s squared, d s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>d</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, negative 5 plus, the integral from negative 5 to t, of, e raised to the negative 2 s power, d s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow></msup><mi>d</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="x of t, equals, 3 plus, the integral from 0 to t, of, s squared, d s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>d</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, negative 5 plus, the integral from 0 to t, of, e raised to the negative 2 s power, d s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow></msup><mi>d</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
